member_organisations:
Information can be accessed via each of our sector groups: 
http://www.ibec.ie/IBEC/BA.nsf/vPages/Home~business-sectors?OpenDocument
fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Culture and media, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Customs, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Banking and financial services, Fraud prevention
eu_initiatives: The policy-making activities of the European Institutions are of significant importance to Irish business. As such, Ibec works to protect and promote the profile and interests of Irish business within the Council of the European Union, the European Council, the European Parliament and the European Commission. Our firm position is that the EU Institutions must properly understand and address the needs of the business community in order to ensure the best possible conditions for economic growth, employment creation and community prosperity.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations

membership:
Ibec and its sectoral trade associations belong to a number of organisations at EU level, including the following: 
 
•    AIM – European Brands Association  
•    Brewers of Europe 
•    BusinessEurope  
•    CAOBISCO – European Chocolate & Confectionery Association  
•    CEEREAL – European Breakfast Cereal Association  
•    CEFIC – European Chemical Industry Council  
•    CEPE – European Council of the Paint, Printing Ink and Artists' Colours Industry 
•    CEMBUREAU – European Cement Association 
•    CLITRAVI – Liaison Centre for the Meat Processing Industry in the EU 
•    Construction Products Europe  
•    Cosmetics Europe 
•    DigitalEurope 
•    EuroCommerce 
•    EuropaBio 
•    EDA – European Dairy Association  
•    European Movement Ireland  
•    EPC – European Policy Centre 
•    ESF – European Services Forum 
•    FEDIAF – European Pet Food Industry Association  
•    FoodDrinkEurope 
•    IIEA – Institute of International & European Affairs  
•    International Association of Soaps, Detergents and Maintenance Products  
•    International Meat Secretariat 
•    MedTech Europe  
•    ORGALIME – European Engineering Industries Association 
•    PlasticsEurope  
•    Specialised Nutrition Europe  
•    SpiritsEurope 
•    UECBV – European Livestock and Meat Trades Union
goals__remit:
•    Ibec is Ireland's national federation of business, industry and employers. It is the largest organisation of its kind in Ireland. Representing businesses of all sizes and across all sectors of the Irish economy, we engage with government, policy makers and key stakeholders at national, EU and global level to shape positive conditions for enterprise, economic growth and employment creation.  
 
•    In addition to our public affairs activities, Ibec offers a range of professional services and supports to our member companies.  
 
•    There are 42 dedicated sectoral trade associations within Ibec.
relevant_communication: Ibec's EU activities, campaigns and positions are communicated by way of newsletters, events, press statements, policy papers and submissions. These can all be accessed via our website at www.ibec.ie
legal_status: Ibec is a limited liability company
